data.title: Portugal as a Digital Nation
data.meta_description:
Opening Remarks from HE Ambassador Manuel Lobo Antunes
    
    Moderator - Jacopo Dettoni, Editor, fDi Intelligence 
    
    Panelists:        
    António Dias Martins - Executive Director, Startup Portugal
    
    Hélder Dias - EVP Product Development, Farfetch
    
    Mariana Jordão - SVP of Operations, Feedzai
    
    Francisco España - Vice-President and General Manager, Defined.ai
    
    Paulo Dimas - VP Product Innovation, Unbabel
    
    Hosted by fDi Intelligence, this webinar on “Portugal as a Digital Nation” will shed light on the country’s flourishing tech scene and the opportunities it creates for trade and investment. Traditionally open for tourism, Portugal is now open for business too, particularly tech business. Quality of life, combined with talent, capital and infrastructure availability, as well as a policy commitment to nurturing the rise of domestic tech ecosystems, have turned the country into a cradle for start-ups and scale-ups. Lisbon and Porto are now ranked among the best place in Europe to launch a start-up, and the overall value of local tech companies is estimated to account for about 15% of the national GDP. The webinar will bring together representatives of some of the country’s fastest-growing scale-ups, including Mariana Jordão, SVP of Operations of unicorn Feedzai, as well as António Dias Martins, the executive director of Startup Portugal, the government’s programme for the development of entrepreneurship that has turned into action the national strategy to develop tech entrepreneurship since 2016. 
    
    Key discussion topics:
    
    - Navigating Portugal's tech landscape. 
    
    - Main perks of doing tech and innovation in Portugal. 
    
    - Scaling up without leaving.  
    
    - Tech powering up Portugal’s economy.
